DOC.brief_summary: Randomized, double-blind, double-dummy, 12-week, active-controlled study of pitavastatin 4 mg daily(QD) vs. pravastatin 40 mg daily(QD) in subjects with primary hyperlipidemia or mixed dyslipidemia.
DOC.brief_title: Prevail-Us: A Study Of Pitavastatin 4 mg Vs. Pravastatin 40 mg In Patients With Primary Hyperlipidemia Or Mixed Dyslipidemia
DOC.criteria: Male and female subjects with primary hypercholesterolemia or mixed dyslipidemia who are ≥18 and ≤80 years of age at the time of consent Plasma Lowdensity lipoprotein cholesterol (LDLC) ≥130 milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL) and ≤220 mg/dL and triglyceride (TG) levels of ≤400 mg/dL Homozygous familial hypercholesterolemia Any conditions which may cause secondary dyslipidemia Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus
